text: We must extend the tax cuts for middle-class families to stimulate economic growth and consumer spending.
Border security is national security - we need complete operational control of our southern border.
Medicare for All would provide comprehensive coverage to every American as a right, not a privilege.
Excessive regulation is strangling small businesses and preventing entrepreneurs from creating jobs.
We must protect DACA recipients who contribute to our communities and know no other home but America.
Association Health Plans allow small businesses to pool resources and offer affordable coverage to employees.
The $1.9 trillion stimulus package prevented economic collapse and helped working families survive the pandemic.
Immigration raids terrorize communities and separate families without addressing root causes of migration.
Price gouging by pharmaceutical companies is immoral and must be stopped through legislative action.
Right-to-work laws protect workers from being forced to join unions against their will.
We need more immigration judges to clear the backlog and ensure timely processing of asylum cases.
Medical malpractice reform would reduce defensive medicine practices that drive up healthcare costs.
Infrastructure investment creates good-paying jobs while rebuilding our crumbling roads and bridges.
Sanctuary cities undermine federal law enforcement and create safe havens for criminal aliens.
The ACA's Medicaid expansion has provided coverage to millions of low-income Americans in participating states.
The federal minimum wage hasn't kept pace with inflation, leaving full-time workers in poverty.
Merit-based immigration would attract the skilled workers our economy needs to compete globally.
Health Savings Accounts give patients more control over their healthcare decisions and spending.
Corporate stock buybacks benefit wealthy shareholders instead of investing in workers and innovation.
We must address the visa overstay crisis - nearly half of undocumented immigrants entered legally.
Single-payer healthcare would eliminate private insurance bureaucracy and reduce administrative waste.
Free trade agreements open new markets for American goods and support export-dependent jobs.
Family-based immigration preserves the fundamental American value of keeping families together.
Certificate of Need laws protect patients by ensuring healthcare facilities meet quality standards.
The gig economy requires new labor protections and benefits for independent contractors.
Border Patrol needs additional resources and personnel to handle the unprecedented surge in crossings.
Community health centers provide essential care to underserved populations and must be fully funded.
Supply chain disruptions highlight the need to reshore critical manufacturing capabilities.
Refugee admissions are a moral obligation that reflects American compassion and global leadership.
Telemedicine expansion during COVID-19 demonstrated how technology can improve access to care.
Paid family leave policies support working parents and strengthen family economic security.
E-verify should be mandatory nationwide to ensure jobs go to legal workers and citizens first.
The VA system provides specialized care for our veterans and must be modernized and adequately funded.
Housing affordability crisis requires zoning reform and increased supply of affordable units.
Temporary Protected Status provides humanitarian relief for those fleeing dangerous conditions.
Mental health parity laws require insurers to cover behavioral health equally with physical health.
Student loan debt cancellation would stimulate the economy and relieve an unsustainable burden.
Asylum fraud undermines the system for those with legitimate claims of persecution.
Right to try laws give terminally ill patients access to experimental treatments without FDA bureaucracy.
Cryptocurrency regulation must balance innovation with consumer protection and financial stability.
Legal immigration levels should be reduced to allow for proper assimilation and wage growth.
Nurse practitioner scope of practice laws should be expanded to address primary care shortages.
Rural broadband expansion is essential infrastructure for economic development and education.
Unaccompanied minors at the border require humane treatment and proper legal representation.
Preexisting condition protections are essential and must be preserved in any healthcare reform.
Antitrust enforcement is needed to combat corporate consolidation and protect consumers.
Birthright citizenship is constitutionally protected and fundamental to our national identity.
Drug importation from Canada would provide immediate relief from prescription price gouging.
Right-to-work states have seen stronger job growth and economic development than forced-union states.
Visa lottery programs randomly select immigrants without considering skills or national interest.
Medical debt should be eliminated from credit reports to prevent lifelong financial harm.
Child care costs are crushing working families and require substantial public investment.
Local police cooperation with ICE is essential for removing criminal aliens from our communities.
Abortion restrictions interfere with the doctor-patient relationship and women's healthcare decisions.
Pension fund solvency requires responsible management and realistic return assumptions.
Agricultural worker visas are essential for maintaining our food supply and farm economy.
Surprise medical billing exploits patients during emergencies and must be banned.
Industrial policy targeting semiconductors and clean energy is necessary for national security.
Public charge rules ensure immigrants are self-sufficient and don't burden taxpayers.
Maternal mortality rates, especially for women of color, require immediate attention and funding.
Opportunity zones have successfully directed investment to distressed communities across America.
We must end catch-and-release policies that allow illegal immigrants to disappear into the interior.
FDA approval process should be streamlined to get new drugs and devices to patients faster.
Collective bargaining rights are fundamental to workers' ability to negotiate fair wages.
Dreamers contribute billions in taxes and are vital to our economy and communities.
Palliative care and hospice services improve quality of life for seriously ill patients.
Raising the SALT deduction cap unfairly subsidizes high-tax states with federal dollars.
Immigration detention centers must meet basic standards of humanity and due process.
Scope of practice laws protect patients by ensuring qualified professionals provide care.
R&D tax credits encourage innovation and keep America competitive in technology sectors.
We need more border patrol agents and enhanced surveillance technology at all points of entry.
The mental health crisis requires integrated services in schools, workplaces, and communities.
Predatory lending practices target vulnerable communities with high-interest loans.
English language proficiency should be a requirement for citizenship and integration.
Value-based care models focus on patient outcomes rather than volume of services provided.
Housing first policies effectively reduce homelessness and are more cost-effective than shelters.
We must combat human trafficking networks that exploit vulnerable migrants at the border.
The opioid epidemic requires comprehensive treatment access and harm reduction strategies.
Tariffs on imported steel protect national security and preserve domestic manufacturing capacity.
Legal immigration attorneys are essential for navigating our complex immigration system.
Price transparency rules empower patients to shop for healthcare like any other service.
Universal basic income experiments show promise for addressing automation-related job loss.
Border wall construction damages sensitive ecosystems and tribal lands.
Community-based services allow seniors and disabled individuals to remain in their homes.
The Jones Act protects national security by maintaining a domestic maritime industry.
Immigrant entrepreneurs start businesses at higher rates and create jobs for Americans.
Biomedical research funding through NIH drives medical breakthroughs and economic growth.
Financial transaction taxes would curb Wall Street speculation while generating revenue.
We must end policies that separate children from their parents at the border immediately.
Medical freedom means patients should have access to alternative and complementary treatments.
Apprenticeship programs provide pathways to skilled trades without college debt.
Immigration backlogs force families to wait years for reunification through legal channels.
The healthcare workforce shortage requires investment in training and education pipelines.
COVID relief fraud wasted hundreds of billions of taxpayer dollars due to poor oversight.
Legal immigration levels should be increased to address labor shortages in key industries.
Private equity ownership of healthcare facilities often leads to reduced quality and access.
The digital divide prevents rural Americans from participating in the modern economy.
Asylum officers should have authority to grant protection at the border instead of courts.
Preventive care saves lives and reduces long-term healthcare costs for everyone.
Right-to-repair laws give consumers and small businesses freedom to fix their own equipment.
Visa overstays represent a major border security vulnerability that must be addressed.
Health insurance cooperatives provide consumer-focused alternatives to for-profit insurers.
The retirement crisis requires strengthening Social Security and promoting retirement savings.
Immigration enforcement should focus on dangerous criminals, not otherwise law-abiding residents.
Medical innovation depends on strong intellectual property protections for new discoveries.
Industrial agriculture consolidation hurts family farms and raises consumer prices.
We need increased diplomatic engagement with Mexico and Central America on migration issues.
The disability insurance program provides crucial support for those unable to work due to illness.
Offshoring American jobs to China has devastated manufacturing communities across the Midwest.
Muslim travel bans were necessary for national security and proper vetting procedures.
Certificate of Need laws create healthcare monopolies and reduce competition and access.
The racial wealth gap requires targeted policies to address historical discrimination.
Immigration benefits our economy by providing workers for growing industries and sectors.
Medical price gouging occurs because patients cannot shop around during emergencies.
The gig economy provides flexible work opportunities that traditional employment doesn't offer.
We must preserve birthright citizenship as guaranteed by the 14th Amendment.
The nursing home industry requires stronger oversight and staffing requirements.
COVID lockdowns caused unprecedented economic damage that will take years to recover from.
Asylum seekers deserve fair hearings and protection from violence in their home countries.
Gene therapy and personalized medicine represent the future of effective healthcare treatment.
Worker cooperatives give employees ownership stakes and voice in company decisions.
Immigration policies should prioritize refugees fleeing religious and political persecution.
The mental health crisis is exacerbated by lack of providers and insurance coverage gaps.
We must immediately extend the Trump tax cuts to ensure working families keep more of their hard-earned money and our economy remains strong.
The Biden administration's open border policies have created a national security and humanitarian crisis that is unsustainable.
Republicans are once again trying to gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions, putting millions of lives at risk.
Raising the corporate tax rate will stifle innovation and send American jobs overseas. We must be competitive on the global stage.
We need a pathway to citizenship for Dreamers who know no other country but America as their home.
Socialized medicine would lead to long wait times, rationed care, and a government takeover of your healthcare decisions.
Record corporate profits while workers' wages stagnate is a sign of a broken system. We need to empower labor unions.
We must end the cruel and inhumane practice of family separation at the border immediately.
The Affordable Care Act has been a lifeline for millions, and we must build on its success, not tear it down.
Deregulation is the key to unlocking the potential of small businesses, the true engine of our economy.
We need to fix our legal immigration system so that it is based on merit and the needs of our economy.
Allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices directly with pharmaceutical companies is essential to lowering costs for seniors.
The Federal Reserve's interest rate hikes are crushing working families with mortgages and car loans.
We must finish building the wall and deploy technology to secure our southern border once and for all.
Price transparency in healthcare will create competition and drive down costs for everyone.
Massive government spending on infrastructure is necessary to create jobs and rebuild America for the 21st century.
Providing legal counsel to every migrant in immigration court is a matter of basic justice and due process.
Expanding telehealth services is critical for providing access to care in rural and underserved communities.
The push for a $15 federal minimum wage will force small businesses to close and increase unemployment.
We should increase the number of H-1B visas for highly skilled workers in the tech and science sectors.
Medical debt is the leading cause of bankruptcy in the United States; we need a system that protects families.
Inflation is a hidden tax on the poor and middle class, caused by out-of-control government spending.
We must reinstate the 'Remain in Mexico' policy to deter illegal border crossings and manage the asylum process.
Defunding Planned Parenthood would be a devastating blow to women's access to critical healthcare services.
Investing in green energy technology will create millions of high-paying jobs and secure our energy independence.
Our cities are being overwhelmed by the influx of migrants; this is a federal problem requiring a federal solution.
We need to expand Medicaid in all states to provide a safety net for our most vulnerable citizens.
The stock market hitting all-time highs is a clear indicator that our pro-growth economic policies are working.
E-Verify must be made mandatory for all employers to ensure jobs go to American citizens and legal residents.
The government has no business getting between a patient and their doctor. Healthcare choices should be personal.
The gig economy provides needed flexibility for workers, and we must protect it from overregulation.
We should offer temporary protected status to those fleeing natural disasters and violence in their home countries.
Mental healthcare is healthcare, and we must fully integrate it into our health insurance coverage and public health strategy.
Tariffs on Chinese goods are necessary to protect American industries and bring manufacturing jobs back home.
Asylum claims should be processed at the border, not lead to a years-long backlog in our immigration courts.
We must pass a public option to create more competition and give every American a choice for affordable health insurance.
The wealth gap between the top 1% and the rest of America is a moral and economic failure that demands action.
Chain migration prioritizes family ties over skills, and it undermines the economic basis of our immigration system.
Tort reform is essential to lower malpractice insurance costs and, in turn, reduce the cost of healthcare for everyone.
We need to break up the big tech monopolies that are stifling competition and harming consumers.
Local law enforcement should not be forced to act as federal immigration agents; it erodes trust in our communities.
The development of a COVID-19 vaccine in record time is a testament to American innovation and private-sector ingenuity.
Universal Basic Income is a radical idea that would disincentivize work and bankrupt the nation.
We must address the root causes of migration from Central America by promoting economic development and stability.
The high cost of insulin is a national disgrace. We must cap out-of-pocket costs for this life-saving drug.
Strong Buy American provisions in federal contracts will ensure our tax dollars support American workers and businesses.
We are a nation of immigrants, but we are also a nation of laws. Our immigration laws must be respected and enforced.
Vaccine mandates are an egregious overreach of government power and an infringement on personal liberty.
The child tax credit has been proven to cut child poverty in half and should be made permanent.
